revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Nasim Pedrad | image = Nasim Pedrad.jpg | caption = Pedrad in 2014 | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1981|11|18}} | birth_place = [[Tehran]], [[Iran]] | home_town = [[Irvine, California]], U.S. |alma_mater = [[University of California, Los Angeles]] | occupation = Actress, comedian | yearsactive = 2005–present | family = Nina Pedrad (sister) }} '''Nasim Pedrad''' ({{lang-fa|نسیم پدراد}}; born November 18, 1981)<ref name="tvg-bio">{{cite web | url = http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/nasim-pedrad/bio/298560 | title = Nasim Pedrad | publisher= [[TV Guide|TVGuide.com]] | accessdate= June 9, 2014}}</ref> is an [[Iranian Americans|Iranian-American]] actress and comedian best known for her five seasons as a cast member on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' from 2009 to 2014. She has since gone on to co-star in sitcoms such as ''[[Mulaney]]'', ''[[Scream Queens (2015 TV series)|Scream Queens]]'', ''[[People of Earth (TV series)|People of Earth]]'', and ''[[New Girl]]''.
==Early life== Pedrad was born in [[Tehran]], [[Iran]], to a [[Muslim]] family.<ref>https://splinternews.com/abc-allegedly-dropped-a-show-about-a-muslim-family-afte-1793858993</ref> Her parents are Arasteh Amani and Parviz Pedrad. Pedrad and her parents lived in Tehran until 1984, before emigrating to the United States. Her younger sister is comedy writer Nina Pedrad.<ref>{{cite web| url= http://splitsider.com/2013/12/30-rock-parks-and-rec/ | title= '30 Rock', 'Parks and Rec', and All the Other Shows You'd Expect Get WGA Nominations | first= Bradford |last= Evans | date= 5 December 2013 |work= Splitsider | accessdate= 2 December 2014}}</ref> Both sisters are fluent in [[Persian language|Persian]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.payvand.com/news/10/jan/1274.html |title=Saturday Night Live Hires First Iranian-Born Cast Member |first= Grace |last= Nasri |work= Iran Times |date=2010-01-28 |accessdate=2011-02-04}}</ref> The sisters were raised in [[Irvine, California]],<ref name=UCBTheatre>{{cite web |title=Los Angeles - Performers - Nasim Pedrad |work=ucbtheatre.com |url=http://losangeles.ucbtheatre.com/performers/8345 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080319000635/http://losangeles.ucbtheatre.com/performers/8345 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2008-03-19 |df= }}</ref> and graduated from [[University High School (Irvine, California)|University High School]].<ref>http://www.orangecoast.com/arts-culture/irivne-native-nasim-pedrad-bids-goodbye-new-girl-hello-aladdin/</ref> Nasim graduated from [[UCLA School of Theater, Film and Television]] in 2003.<ref name=UCBTheatre /> She was a member of the [[UCLA Spring Sing#Company| UCLA Spring Sing Company]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://alumni.ucla.edu/stories/nasim-pedrad/|title=Nasim Pedrad {{!}}|website=alumni.ucla.edu|language=en-US|access-date=2017-04-16}}</ref>
==Career==
===Early work=== Pedrad was a performer with the Sunday Company at [[The Groundlings]].<ref name=UCBTheatre /> She frequently performed her one-woman show ''Me, Myself & Iran'' at the [[Los Angeles]] divisions of [[ImprovOlympic]] and the [[Upright Citizens Brigade Theater]]. The show was selected for the 2007 HBO Comedy Festival in Las Vegas. She received an ''[[LA Weekly]]'' Best Comedic Performance of the Year Award as the lead in the comedic spoof ''After School Special''.<ref name=UCBTheatre/>
Pedrad made her first television appearance on an episode of ''[[Gilmore Girls]]''. In 2007, she made a guest appearance on ''[[The Winner (TV series)|The Winner]]''. She had a recurring role on ''[[ER (TV series)|ER]]'' as Nurse Suri.<ref name=UCBTheatre/> In 2009, she had a guest appearance on ''[[It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia]]''.<ref name="ratings">{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2009/11/06/its-always-sunny-in-philadelphia-and-the-league-up-over-50-without-world-series/32871|title=''It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia'' and ''The League'' up over 50% without World Series|work=TV by the Numbers|last=Seidman|first=Robert|date=November 6, 2009|accessdate=August 13, 2010}}</ref>
===''Saturday Night Live''=== Pedrad joined the cast of ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' in 2009 as part of the [[Saturday Night Live (season 35)|35th]] (2009–2010) season. Pedrad is one of a handful of cast members born outside North America (joining Italian-born [[Tony Rosato]], New Zealand-born [[Pamela Stephenson]], English-born [[Morwenna Banks]], and Chilean-born [[Horatio Sanz]]), and is the show's first female Middle-Eastern cast member. Pedrad became a repertory player in the [[Saturday Night Live (season 37)|2011–12 season]] after two years of being a featured player. Pedrad left ''SNL'' in 2014 to work on ''[[Mulaney]]'',<ref name="Mulaney"/> but the show was cancelled in March 2015.
====Recurring characters==== {{div col|colwidth=18em}} *Bedelia *Li'l Blaster *Poppy *Hu Jintao's Translator *Tippy *Nancy *Shallon *Heshy {{div col end}}
====Celebrity impressions on SNL==== {{div col|colwidth=18em}} *[[Kim Kardashian]] *[[Arianna Huffington]] *[[Aziz Ansari]] *[[Kathy Griffin]] *[[Mary-Kate Olsen]] *[[Shakira]] *[[Barbara Walters]] *[[Barbara Boxer]] *[[Sonia Sotomayor]] *[[Christiane Amanpour]] *[[Christina Aguilera]] *[[Alicia Keys]] *[[Vanessa Hudgens]] *[[Sharon Osbourne]] *[[Edie Falco]] *[[Gloria Allred]] *[[M.I.A. (rapper)]] *[[Nicki Minaj]] *[[Kelly Ripa]] *[[Paula Abdul]] *[[Hoda Kotb]] *[[Marilyn Monroe]] *[[Lea Michele]] *[[Rosie McClelland]] *[[Kristin Chenoweth]] *[[Bruno Mars]] *[[Bobby Jindal]] *[[Jenna von Oÿ]] *[[Ma Anand Sheela]] {{div col end}}
===Other work=== In 2011, she was a recurring voice on the [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] animated series ''[[Allen Gregory]]''. She appeared with a small role in the 2011 film ''[[No Strings Attached (film)|No Strings Attached]]''. In 2012, she had a supporting voice role in the animated feature film ''[[The Lorax (film)|The Lorax]]'' and a small appearance in ''[[The Dictator (2012 film)|The Dictator]]''. In 2013, Pedrad had another supporting voice role in ''[[Despicable Me 2]]''. In the autumn of 2014, she left ''Saturday Night Live'' to star in a new [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] [[sitcom]], ''[[Mulaney]]''.<ref name="Mulaney">{{cite news | url = http://www.tvguide.com/News/Nasim-Pedrad-Leaving-SNL-Mulaney-1084671.aspx?rss=news | title = Nasim Pedrad Talks Departing SNL for Mulaney: "At Some Point You Have to Leave" | first = Kate | last = Stanhope | date = Jul 20, 2014 <!-- 04:30 PM ET --> | accessdate = 2014-09-08 | work = [[TV Guide|TVGuide.com]] | publisher = [[CBS Interactive]] }}</ref> On October 18, 2014, Fox shut down production of the series by reducing the 16-episode order by three episodes. Filming for the thirteenth episode had just been completed prior to the order reduction, and the fourteenth episode was about to enter production.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2014/10/mulaney-order-cut-13-episodes-fox-854490/|title=‘Mulaney’ Order Trimmed To 13 Episodes|author=Nellie Andreeva|work=Deadline}}</ref>
Beginning in 2015, Pedrad has a recurring guest role as [[Los Angeles Police Department|LAPD]] officer Aly Nelson on the Fox sitcom ''[[New Girl]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2015/01/08/tuesday-final-ratings-no-adjustments-to-agent-carter-person-of-interest-or-forever/347207/|title=Tuesday Final Ratings: No Adjustments to 'Agent Carter', 'Person of Interest' or 'Forever'|work=TV by the Numbers|first=Sara|last=Bibel|date=January 8, 2015|accessdate=January 8, 2015}}</ref> She portrayed Gigi Caldwell in the first season of [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] horror-comedy ''[[Scream Queens (2015 TV series)|Scream Queens]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dreadcentral.com/news/92785/nasim-pedrad-joins-scream-queens/|title=Nasim Pedrad Joins Scream Queens - Dread Central|website=www.dreadcentral.com|accessdate=17 April 2018}}</ref>
In 2016, she appeared in a commercial for [[Old Navy]] alongside comedian [[Kumail Nanjiani]] and other SNL cast members [[Cecily Strong]] and [[Jay Pharoah]].
In 2017, she joined the cast of second season of the [[TBS (U.S. TV channel)|TBS]] comedy series ''[[People of Earth (TV series)|People of Earth]]''. Later that same year she also made guest appearances on ''[[Curb Your Enthusiasm]]'' and ''[[Brooklyn Nine Nine]]''.
